translated: Through whatever merit I have created by this continuous praise,üîΩMay this creeper, at the end of time, bear fruit for beings,üîΩWith the flowers of the Victor's sons and the fruit called enlightenment.

original: 'khri shing 'di ni rgyal ba'i sras kyi me tog dang // byang chub ces bya'i 'bras bur 'bras dang bcas gyur cig / dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i bstod pa rgyun chags pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'khri shing 'di ni rgyal ba'i sras kyi me tog dang // byang chub ces bya'i 'bras bur 'bras dang bcas gyur cig / dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i bstod pa rgyun chags pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Continuous Praise of Glorious Kalachakra

original: ka li dka'i rgyal po'i bla ma sde snod gsum bshad pa'i mkhas pa chen po legs pa'i grags pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ka li dka'i rgyal po'i bla ma sde snod gsum bshad pa'i mkhas pa chen po legs pa'i grags pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: Composed by the great scholar Legs pa'i grags pa, the guru of the king of Kali.

original: // / rgya gar ghi pandi ta bi n'a ya shr'i mi tra dang / ldan ma tshul khrims seng ges chu mig ring mor bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar ghi pandi ta bi n'a ya shr'i mi tra dang / ldan ma tshul khrims seng ges chu mig ring mor bsgyur ba'o//
translated: Translated by the Indian Pandit Vinayashrimitra and the Tibetan translator Darma Tsultrim at Chumig Ringmo.
